results.title: Grace
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Isabel Perez, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A lonely girl left looking after the family motel finds her life is about to change when a sophisticated and elegant woman books in for the night.
Cast: Mariel McClovey, Angela Punch McGregor, Tim Richards

results.title: Dressing dad
results.creator_credit: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Isabel Perez, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
If your dad wore a dress, would it make him less of a father, less of a man? A daughter’s journey to understand her father’s long-kept secret as a cross-dresser.
Cast: Alastair Barns (the dad), Lynne Vincent McCarthy as the daughter voice-over, and Leslie, Bianca, Kimberley, Steffie and Kim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Isabel Perez, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.description:

results.title: The Lama of Greystanes
results.brief_description:
Zatul Rinzin Rinpoche is the 11th reincarnation of the lama (or spiritual leader) of the highest monastery in the world, Rongbuk, which lies at the foot of Mount Everest in western Tibet.
In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.
Rinzin is no longer a monk but he is still a lama - a responsibility he must hold his entire life. He now works as a security guard to support himself, his family and his monastery back in Tibet.
results.description:
Zatul Rinzin Rinpoche is the 11th reincarnation of the lama (or spiritual leader) of the highest monastery in the world, Rongbuk, which lies at the foot of Mount Everest in western Tibet.
In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.
Rinzin is no longer a monk but he is still a lama - a responsibility he must hold his entire life. He now works as a security guard to support himself, his family and his monastery back in Tibet.

In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.

results.title: Cherish
results.creator_credit: Romaine Moreton, Stephen Jones and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“What peace is there for us whose best love cannot return them even for a day? …..The last word was yours.” (Jeannette Winterson ‘Written on the Body’)
A poetic and tender story celebrating life, love and death.
Cast: John Adam, Russell Page

results.title: The Cup and the lip
results.creator_credit: Joanna Robinski, Bruno de Villenoisy and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A difficult child and a good mother. A loose tooth, a sign on a wall, an imaginary word, ecstasy, anger… A disturbing film about the ultimate taboo.
Cast: Gosia Dobrowolska, Julian Barta

results.title: Range of experience
results.creator_credit: Lisa Duff, Marc Gillezeau, Maryella Hatfield and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
It is the future - a world where the ability to experience life’s basic emotions has been lost to humanity and Virtual Reality has replaced dreams. The company Range of Experience Productions Inc has invented the Dream Base Selector, a machine which enables users to re-live experiences once created naturally by the subconscious mind. But it soon becomes apparent that the technology is slightly faulty…
Cast: Soledad Cordeaux

results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Jason Camenzuli, Sean Croyston, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.

results.title: Midas
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Isabel Perez and Niki Bern
results.brief_description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.

results.title: The Door
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jo-Anne McGowan and Josie Keys
results.brief_description: A bedroom door becomes the focus of a teenage girl’s battle with her insensitive stepfather to reclaim the simpler relationship she remembers sharing with her mother. Stars Barry Otto and Penne Hackforth-Jones. Original format 16mm.
